WorkItem.Description: After I have completed the rawr for my Prot Warrior, Including all my self passive buffs, I seem to be missing 400hp, even though my stamina is correct. I have jsut about 400 more HP in-game.

Comments.Message: Might be Toughness; are you a miner? It's listed in buffs.
Yea I have toughness checked off too, but toughness is a stamina buff and it gets factored into my stamina, which is correct.

Slight Change to my issue, I just downloaded the latest version and Imported my character from wow armory, and filled in all my buffs etc, and now my stamina is still correct, but I have about 1k hp more then I do in-game.
Also my armor is slightly higher on rawr then in-game, however the damage mitigation is 2% less then in game.

Armor will likely be slightly off, due to rounding. Damage mitigation will be significantly off from what you see on your character screen, since it varies by target level. You have less mitigation than your character sheet shows, against bosses.
Could you attach a character file so I can see the hp difference?

Well yea that's the thing though, my armor is higher on rawr(slightly) but when i mouse over, the damaged reduced is lower then the armor amount in game. However I am more concerned with the HP difference that i am having.

My only thought would be the endurance buff, which increases base HP by 5%, and hypothetically if endurance buff (on rawr) took 5% of my total health it would produce a little less then 1.5k hp, If its not that then I think the only thing that would be wrong is how much HP 1 stamina gives.
It's the tauren racial. It hasn't been updated in the protwarr module to reflect it's change to base health instead of overall health.
Fix checked in, will be in the next build.

Just noting this as I recently noticed this issue pop up in a tanking spreadsheet comment:
"... the in game the bonus is calculated from 8121 [instead of 7941]. If you notice, the health you get from stam on your character sheet isn't what you would expect from the amount of stam you actually have. When naked, I have 170 stam talented, and I get 1520 health from it. So the first 18 are considered "base" for the calculation of the tauren bonus."

Since the value it was updated to is 8338 (7941 * 1.05), that would seem to be incorrect and it should be 8527 (8121 * 1.05)

I don't have a high-level Tauren, so I cannot confirm.
